intro: Dracophyllum heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable dracophyllum, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, thriving in well-drained, acidic soils. Its leaves are leathery and aromatic, often used in traditional Māori medicine. Dracophyllum heterophyllum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native wildlife.
